result.execSummary:
Anthony Bijon Logan was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Anthony Bijon Logan was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Bijon Logan

records.addlTxt:
[ae] case called 2:13 PM  Defendant Anthony Bijon Logan not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived extradition, the Court has been informed that the Defendant has been picked up.
ADA Shock motions to dismiss the case, the Court grants motion and dismisses case
recess: 2:15 pm
[Jail RUMS] Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (09/26) ML
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

[ae] case called 8:12 AM Defendant Anthony Bijon Logan in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Mr. Simonds verifies name and date of birth
Right to Counsel reviewed. 

The Court finds Defendant competent to represent himself; further that waiver of counsel is being made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.

The Court finds that the Defendant is the same as charged in the complaint. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is a fugitive of justice. 


The Defendant has signed Waiver of Extradition paperwork. 
The Court orders Defendant committed to Jefferson County Jail  without bond not to exceed 30 days to allow time for requesting State to be picked up on warrant. 

recess: 8:25 am

MEXT Status Conference on 10/15/22 at 8:15 am
Extradition hearing on September 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

[MK] case called at 1:50pm 
Defendant Anthony Bijon Logan appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  Public Defender Cassi Nelson is present, however she indicates that Mr. Logan is declining PD representation.  . 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Extradition Complaint admitted.
Extradition rights are reviewed. 
Right to counsel is given.  Mr. Logan indicates that he is waiving his right to counsel.  He intends to waive his extradition rights. 
Attorney Nelson indicates that she has gone over with Mr. Logan his extradition rights, his right to counsel, and the waiver of extradition process.
The Court finds that Mr. Logan is competent to represent himself for today's proceeding. 
recess 1:59pm. 

NEXT:  Waiver of Extradition Hearing in Branch III on September 15th at 8:15am
